alert.note: Alert for Charleston; Coastal Colleton (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued June 08 at 9:49PM EDT until June 09 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 AM EDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Up to one half foot of inundation above ground level expected along shorelines and tidal waterways (6.9 to 7.1 feet Mean Lower Low Water at Charleston). * WHERE...Coastal Colleton and Charleston Counties. * WHEN...Until 3 AM EDT Friday. * IMPACTS...This could result in some roads becoming impassable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...High tide will occur around 12:54 AM Friday at Charleston. Saltwater inundation will be possible 1 to 2 hours before and after high tide. Time of high total tides are approximate to the nearest hour. Charleston Harbor SC MLLW Categories - Minor 7.0 ft, Moderate 7.5 ft, Major 8.0 ft MHHW Categories - Minor 1.2 ft, Moderate 1.7 ft, Major 2.2 ft Total Total Departure Day/Time Tide Tide from Norm Waves Flood ft MLLW ft MHHW ft ft Impact -------- --------- --------- --------- ------- -------- 09/01 AM 7.0 1.2 0.9 N/A Minor 09/01 PM 6.1 0.3 1.1 N/A None 10/02 AM 6.8 1.0 1.0 N/A None 10/02 PM 6.2 0.4 1.0 N/A None 11/03 AM 6.5 0.7 0.9 N/A None 11/03 PM 6.3 0.5 0.9 N/A None &&
info.instruction: If travel is required, allow extra time as some roads may be closed. Do not drive around barricades or through water of unknown depth. Take the necessary actions to protect flood-prone property. Visit water.weather.gov for additional water level and flood impact information.
